properties.description: Example: ASC29001
properties.title: ASC Number

properties.description:
The number of the box and file that contains the print. Note that there is a space before and after the "/".

Example: 1974-002 / 590
properties.title: Box and file number

properties.description:
Occasionally there will be multiple folders of the same topic. In this case, note which folder this is.

Example: Folder 2 of 2.
properties.title: Identifier Other

properties.description:
If you are a Bib Services student enter: [to be supplied]

If you are an Archives/Bib Services staff member create a title based on the content of the photograph, incorporating any annotations on the reverse of the print, prioritizing captions or clippings pasted in from the printed issue of the Telegram.
properties.title: Title

properties.description: If you are an Archives/Bib Services staff member, and have additional details to add in terms of the quality of the image, manipulation techniques or additional contextual information, please note it here.
properties.title: Description

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Type

properties.description: Enter the name of the photographer if their name is stamped or written on the verso of the print, referring to the Toronto Telegram photographers listing. If there is no name visible, enter [Telegram staff] using square brackets. If this is a reproduction print from a wire service, enter the full authority name, referring to the Wire Service Companies listing.
properties.title: Name

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Type

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Name

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Role

properties.description:
Date the photographer wrote on the assignment envelope, likely on the back. Write this date without punctuation in the following format (including full month): 18 January 1967.

Sometimes the information is incomplete, in which case, use the date information on the front of the envelope, to supplement the information you have, using square brackets. For more examples, see the Toronto Telegram FAQ.
properties.title: Date taken (free text)

properties.description: This is the date the photograph was taken. Potentially stamped on the verso of the print, or noted in the caption information. Write this date in the following format YYYY-MM-DD (i.e. 1945-01-18). For more examples see the a href="https://digital.library.yorku.ca/content/toronto-telegram-faq" target="_blank">Toronto Telegram FAQ.
properties.title: Date taken (iso)

properties.description: This is the date the print was first published in the Telegram. Likely stamped on the verso of the print.
properties.title: Date published (iso)

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Country

properties.description: Describe the item using the following format: 1 photograph : b&w print ; ##.# x ##.# cm
properties.title: Format

properties.description: 1 print scanned out of folder.
properties.title: Relation

properties.description: If known, enter the full citation for the date(s) the image was published in the Telegram, following the Chicago Manual of Style. i.e. First Name Last Name (of reporter), “Article Title,” The Toronto Telegram, Month dd, yyyy, edition, Section page number. If image has been published in subsequent years, in other publications, films, articles or monographs, enter additional citations.
properties.title: Publications

properties.description: Enter URI for digitized negative.
properties.title: Negative URI

properties.description: Title proper of the file folder, as listed in the Telegram finding aid.
properties.title: Title

properties.description: Enter URI for Toronto Telegram file level uri in finding aid, if it exists.
properties.title: Parent URI

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Title (Finding aid)

properties.description:
If you are a Bib Services student, do not enter any topics.

If you are an Archives/Bib Services staff member, enter subject headings based on the policy available in the Toronto Telegram FAQ.

For PDF, derive generalized subject entries from the assignment envelope, or, the general subject heading as determined in the finding aid.

For TIF, include subject entries used at the assignment envelope. However, you may also add specific subject entries that may relate only to the image you are describing.
properties.title: Topic

properties.description:
If you ware a Bib Services student, enter basic information, following policy outlined in the Toronto Telegram FAQ.

If you are an Archives/Bib Services staff member, confirm any information entered by students and add more precise locations, based on policy outlined in the Toronto Telegram FAQ.
properties.title: Geographic Information

properties.description: Name of a country, i.e. a political entity considered a country.
properties.title: Country

properties.description: Includes first order political divisions within a country, i.e. provinces in Canada, states in USA.
properties.title: Province

properties.description: Includes regions that have status as a jurisdiction, usually incorporating more than one first level jurisdiction. i.e. York Region includes both the city of Markham and the city of Vaughan.
properties.title: Region

properties.description: Name of the largest local administrative unit, i.e. Dufferin County.
properties.title: County

properties.description: Name of an inhabited place incorporated as a city, town, etc.
properties.title: City

properties.description: Name of a smaller unit within a populated place, e.g., neighbourhoods, parks, or streets. See Toronto Telegram FAQ for more details.
properties.title: City Section

properties.description:
Please put coordinates in decimal format: 43.653333, -79.383889

DO NOT use degree format 43°39′12″N 079°23′02″W

See Toronto Telegram FAQ for more details.
Select from the drop down list.

index.key: Photograph now in public domain. For citation information or to obtain high resolution image, contact ascproj@yorku.ca or see Toronto Telegram FAQ.

options.index: Photograph taken by Toronto Telegram photographer before 1962?

index.key: Copyright owned by York University. For permission to publish or other copyright questions, contact ascproj@yorku.ca

options.index: Photograph taken by Toronto Telegram photographer on/or after 1962?

index.key: Copyright owned by photographer. For more information see Toronto Telegram FAQ.
Copyright owned by wire service. For more information contact, ascproj@yorku.ca

properties.title: Usage rights

properties.description: Select from the drop down list.
properties.title: In copyright?

properties.description: Select from the drop down list.

options.index: Photograph taken by Toronto Telegram photographer before 1962?

properties.title: Public Domain
